text: Sitochroa aureolalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Duryea Hulst in 1886. It is found in the United States, where it has been recorded from southern California to Arizona and Texas. It is also found in northern Mexico. The wingspan is about 25 mm for both males and females. The forewings are bright deep golden yellow. The hindwings are yellow fuscous.Transactions of the American Entomological Society 13: 156 Adults have been recorded on wing from May to June and from August to September. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1886 Category:Pyraustinae
title: Sitochroa aureolalis
